sections.title: Section 1: Loading and Inspecting News Data

questions.question: What Python library is used to load the news articles CSV file in the demo?
What is the purpose of calling `news.head()` after loading the CSV?

options.A: To show the last five rows of the DataFrame
options.B: To show the first five rows of the DataFrame
options.C: To count the number of articles

questions.question: **(Medium) ** Which columns are present in the loaded news DataFrame?

options.A: A list of all article authors
options.C: A pandas Series containing all article titles
options.D: The full text of each article

questions.question: Why is it important to inspect the data types of columns in the DataFrame before processing?

options.A: To ensure compatibility with NLP tools
options.D: To convert all numbers to strings

sections.title: Section 2: Named Entity Recognition with spaCy

questions.question: **(Medium) ** Which steps are required before performing NER on article titles using spaCy?

options.B: Pass the text through the model
options.C: Convert the DataFrame to a NumPy array

questions.question: What type of object is returned when you process a string with a spaCy model (e.g., `nlp(title)`)?
**(Hard) ** Which attributes or methods can be used to extract named entities from a spaCy Doc object?
What is the output of iterating over `doc.ents` for a processed title?

options.B: Each named entity and its label (e.g., "Barack Obama" – PERSON)

sections.title: Section 3: Interpreting and Using NER Output

questions.question: What does the NER label "ORG" typically represent?
**(Medium) ** Which of the following are standard NER entity types in spaCy?
If a title contains "Apple launches new iPhone," which entities and labels would spaCy most likely assign?
Why might different spaCy models yield different NER results on the same text?

options.A: They are trained on different data and have different vocabularies
options.B: They always return the same output

questions.question: **(Hard) ** What are potential uses of NER output in analyzing a news article corpus?

options.A: Identifying trends in organizations or people mentioned
options.B: Filtering articles by location or product
options.D: Counting the frequency of entity types
